findings.title: Possible loss of funds by the manager
findings.description: The manager has full access to vault rebalance parameters and can burn all liquidity in the Uniswap pool, swap assets via low-level call, or pass his address as a recipient to the swap function.

findings.title: Possible uniswap pool manipulation
findings.description: Arbitrary users can burn all the pool's liquidity and the vault won't receive any yield until the next rebalance.

findings.title: Possible fee hijacking (or DOS) by the manager
findings.description: An attacker with manager access could set `managerFeeBPS = 10000 - arrakisFeeBPS` to steal all the yield (+ all the accrued manager fees).

findings.title: Liquidity withdrawal from Uni position to Vault
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: High First minter can change LP token pricing
findings.description: If init0 and init1 are less than 1e18, then the first minter can mint mintAmount_ = 1 wei for amount0 = 1 wei and amount1 = 1 wei regardless of the values init0 and init1.

findings.title: Vault can renew the term for free
findings.description: The vault owner mints 1 wei when deploying a vault with openTerm(). Then they can renew term for free since in the function renewTerm() at PALMTerms.sol#L153, emolumentShares are calculated from the balance of PALMTerms and the function increaseLiquidity() doesn't mint new LP tokens.

findings.title: Vault owner can lose tokens when increasing liquidity
findings.description: `increaseLiquidity()` would lose tokens in the vault's address.

findings.title: Rebalance DoS
findings.description: The manager has full access to vault rebalance parameters, allowing them to burn all liquidity in the Uniswap pool, perform asset swaps via low-level calls, or pass their address as a recipient to the swap function, potentially leading to loss of funds.

findings.title: Checking caller
findings.description: Function addVault() doesn't check msg.sender. Anyone can call this function and add vault if its owner is terms.

findings.title: No check if liquidity > 0 in standardBurnParams()
findings.description: In the function `standardBurnParams()` there is no check if `burns[i].liquidity > 0`. If `burns[i].liquidity = 0`, then `burn()` in `ArrakisV2` will revert.

findings.title: Anyone can call renewTerm()
findings.description: In the function `renewTerm()` at line 143 of PALMTerms.sol, there is no check if the caller is the owner of the vault. An attacker can frontrun `closeTerm()` and call `renewTerm()`, then the vault would pay the emolument twice.

findings.title: Redundant modifier
findings.description: `PALMManager`'s methods have redundant `onlyVaultOwner` modifier which can be replaced with `onlyPALMTerms`.

findings.title: Unused modifier code duplication
findings.description: `PALMManagerStorage` `removeVault` function has the same `require` check as `onlyManagedVaults` modifier.

findings.title: Reducing SLOAD operations
findings.description: You can reduce SLOAD operations by copying often-used storage variables to memory.

findings.title: Event indexed fields
findings.description: In ArrakisV2Storage, events LogMint, LogBurn and LPBurned could be modified to have reciever (user) field indexed to improve parsing user balance.

findings.title: Typo in function naming
findings.description: Variables and constants are not following the mixedCase and UPPER_CASE_WITH_UNDERSCORES naming conventions.

findings.title: Direct token transfers
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Range existence check
findings.description: The function ranges() has external calls inside a loop which can cause gas inefficiency.

findings.title: Gas optimisation in range deletion
findings.description: The pool is only removed from `_pools`, but there might be active positions with same fee tier in `_ranges`. It is recommended to remove ranges with the same fee tier when removing a pool and ensure they have no liquidity.

findings.title: Zero address check
findings.description: Lack of zero-check on addresses in various functions.

findings.title: Bad readability
findings.description: The comments at lines PALMTerms.sol#L83 and PALMTerms.sol#L92 are irrelevant.

findings.title: Redundant modifier
findings.description: `PALMManager`'s methods have redundant `onlyVaultOwner` modifier which can be replaced with `onlyPALMTerms`.

findings.title: Gas optimisation in vaults()
findings.description: The function may run out of gas if there are a lot of vaults deployed.

findings.title: Gas optimisation in conversion from int to string
findings.description: Function _uint2str is more gas expansive than Openzeppelin function toString(). It is recommended to use Openzeppelin function toString() to convert uint to str.

findings.title: Code refactoring
findings.description: The variables ArrakisV2._rebalance(Rebalance).balance0Before and ArrakisV2._rebalance(Rebalance).balance1Before have similar names.

findings.title: Zero liquidity check
findings.description: There is no check if `burns[i].liquidity > 0` . If `burns[i].liquidity = 0` , then `burn()` in `ArrakisV2` will revert.

findings.title: Blacklisting strategy
findings.description: In `PALMManagerStorage` contract there is a method to whitelist strategies, but there is no method to blacklist them if a strategy is irrelevant or ineffective.

findings.title: Redundant approve call
findings.description: At Lines 104-105 vault's allowance is set to zero for both tokens, but it is already zero.

findings.title: Unmatched to documentation
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: No max limit for ranges
findings.description: The function `ranges()` in ArrakisV2Helper has no max limit and can lead to gas inefficiency if there are a lot of vaults deployed.

findings.title: Variable totalSupply shadows function
findings.description: The variable `totalSupply` shadows the function `totalSupply()`.

findings.title: Possible to use LP token as vault token
findings.description: In the function mint() at lines [ArrakisV2.sol#L86-L94], it is possible to use LP token of the vault as token0 or token1.

findings.title: Possible to burn zero LP tokens
findings.description: In the function `burn()` at line 101 of ArrakisV2.sol, the parameter `burnAmount_` is not checked to be bigger than `0`.

findings.title: Incorrect event emit
findings.description: Some fees will be collected when burning liquidity, so this event emit `LogUncollectedFees()` is incorrect.

findings.title: TODO comments
findings.description: Irrelevant TODO comments found at lines 83 and 92 of PALMTerms.sol.

findings.title: Using a number literal
findings.description: The code uses literals with too many digits which can cause precision loss.

findings.title: Inadequate view functions in ArrakisV2Storage
findings.description: Some view functions in ArrakisV2Storage are not declared as external.

findings.title: Function removePools() doesn't remove ranges
findings.description: The function removePools() only removes pools from _pools but does not remove corresponding ranges with the same fee tier from _ranges.

findings.title: Functions can be declared as external
findings.description: Some functions are not declared as external which could lead to optimization issues.

findings.title: Function vaults() may run out of gas
findings.description: The function `vaults()` at lines 57-65 in ArrakisV2Factory.sol may run out of gas if there are a lot of vaults deployed.

findings.title: Unnecessary external calls
findings.description: Some functions should be declared as external.
